intro: Vasconcellea cundinamarcensis, commonly known as the Cundinamarca waxplant, is a flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the family Caricaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and evergreen leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It is often found in humid, tropical regions and thrives in well-drained soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
